title: Tortura y crímenes en la Esmeralda
description: Arpillera de colleción Isabel Morel. This arpillera depicts the tortures and crimes against humanity that took place on the naval training ship Esmeralda. Many women and men that were taken captive were beat, starved, and denied basic essentials.
subject: Threading Injustice
source: Museum of Memory and Human Rights, Aprilleras colección Isabel Morel; Photo scanned and edited by Emily Vo
rights: Material is housed in the Museum of Memory and Human Rights in Santiago, Chile

title: Torturas
description: Arpillera de colleción Isabel Morel. This arpillera depicts the tortures committed by police and military officiers under Pinochet's dictatorship.
subject: Threading Injustice
source: Museum of Memory and Human Rights, Aprilleras colección Isabel Morel; Photo scanned and edited by Emily Vo
rights: Material is housed in the Museum of Memory and Human Rights in Santiago, Chile

title: Asesinato de Victor Jara
description: Arpillera de colleción Isabel Morel. This arpillera depicts the killing of Victor Jara, noteable folk singer and activist. Jara was taken to the National Stadium during the 1973 coup and executed by the military dictatorship.
subject: Threading Injustice
source: Museum of Memory and Human Rights, Aprilleras colección Isabel Morel; Photo scanned and edited by Emily Vo
rights: Material is housed in the Museum of Memory and Human Rights in Santiago, Chile

title: Nacen los talleres de arpilleras
description: Arpillera de colleción Isabel Morel. This arpillera depicts workershops organized by arpilleristas in order to gather, create arpilleras and share stories.
subject: Threading Injustice
source: Museum of Memory and Human Rights, Aprilleras colección Isabel Morel; Photo scanned and edited by Emily Vo
rights: Material is housed in the Museum of Memory and Human Rights in Santiago, Chile

title: Caja de crédito popular
description: Creator Beatriz Brinkmann, Arpillera de colleción Kinderhilfe Chile Bonn. During the Pinochet dictatorship in Chile, popular credit was largely restricted and negatively impacted by the regime's economic policies, influenced by the neoliberal policies implemented by the Chicago Boys. These policies, coupled with the privatization of state-owned industries and banks, significantly reduced access to credit for many Chilean citizens.
subject: Resistance Embroidery
source: Museum of Memory and Human Rights, Aprilleras colección Kinderhilfe Chile Bonn; Photo scanned and edited by Emily Vo
rights: Material is housed in the Museum of Memory and Human Rights in Santiago, Chile
